intro: Solanum gilioides, commonly known as the gilioides nightshade, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with five petals, and it produces small, yellowish berries that contain toxic alkaloids. Due to its toxic properties, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
